instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [FUBAR]820-3115 Water Damaged
threads.message: Kinda stumped on where to go with this one.. Missing PP5V_S5 and the SMC area is getting really warm (and is shorted), however I do indeed have pp3v42_g3h and a green light on the charger. I have gone back to the S5 enables and found 1.2v on pin 6 of u7941 (supposed to be PP3v3_s5)... I've also discovered I have 3.4v on pins 1,2 and 3 (but nothing in this area is shorted).. My assumption based on how fucked the area near the SMC looked is that the problem is in that area (image attached). All caps on that line are shorted and 2 have been removed because they were completely black and burned.. any help on how to go about repairing this?

threads.title: [FUBAR]820-3115 Water Damaged
threads.message: Looks like a short in the PCB. Scrape away the charred crap and hope the short goes away. Chance of this being fixable is pretty low though.

threads.title: [FUBAR]820-3115 Water Damaged
threads.message: Scratched it off and yeah, still shorted.. Probably just gonna call it a dead one cause I'd rather not put a ton of time into this

threads.title: [FUBAR]820-3115 Water Damaged
threads.message: Yeah, it is also in an area where there would be traces in the other layers so digging this short out will destroy the traces.
